question: Who administers oath to the Prime Minister of India?
explanation: The president administers the oaths of office and secrecy to the Prime Minister of India before he enters upon his office. The Prime Minister swears that he will not directly or indirectly communicate or reveal to any person(s) any matter that is brought under his consideration or becomes known to him as a Union Minister except as may be required for the due discharge of his duties as such minister.
